comment: She explained all the material really well, and in the last few classes, she covered interesting math-related things. The tests were not too difficult if you understand the material. And she explained some of the concepts in easy-to-understand terms. Great professor!
Very good teacher, responds fast to emails and makes boring lectures a bit more interesting. She is very understanding and an overall good teacher. Definitely recommend for honors.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Super sweet professor but it is a boring class. So, if you can sit and occasionally participate in discussions on top of completing the few assignments, you can easily make a A. Can only miss 2 classes though, very easy grader, and responds to emails fast.

hon 1100 is so boring and theres no way around that but dr. M is very kind and understanding to each student and will make an effort to accommodate you if you communicate. took her 7 weeks course at 6-8pm so lectures were long and assignments are every other week but if you put in an hour or so of work to get it out of the way, you'll be fine

Loved Dr. Miller! She was so understanding when I was out with the flu and I met with her during office hours and she retaught what they learned in class. Reminds me of a highschool math class in the way she teaches. Not a lot of homework, and wasn't for a grade but I recommend doing it! I took this as an honors class so it was a pretty small class

This class makes you feel so dumb because the material is simple but the way she grades is awful. It is never consistent and you will be docked for the simple things. Basically if your explanation for a math problem could be confusing to a student, you will get no credit for it. Not the biggest problem but she was not consistent with how she grades

Dr. Miller is a very sweet professor. She is quick to answer emails and is nice when giving feedback. However, she grades things very hard. There were 3 exams in her class. Exam 3 was SO hard for no reason (which she acknowledged but didn't curve). Attendance is mandatory and at the end of the semester we had to say why we should get a good grade.

She was a very wonderful professor and her lectures were and class work were usually pretty manageable. I will say, dont do what I did and put this class on the back burner because that almost led me to have to retake that class. However, she did pass me with a C, and for that I will forever be thankful.

Dr. Miller was always willing to meet with me outside of class when needed. Classes were mostly lecture with time for breakout groups. She was a fair grader but seemed to be very slow. She is very understanding but will not take anything late so make sure everything is in on time. She gave us a covid cushion in our grading which was helpful.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria
